data.title: Snowden: "I think a person should be able to dial a number, make a purchase, send an SMS, write an e-mail, or visit a Web site without having to think about what it's going to look like on their permanent record."
Stephen Hawking announces in surprising statement that 'black holes', as most people, even physicists, understand them, do not exist.
German Olympians will be wearing rainbow-colored uniforms in Sochi
Confirmed: Protesters in Ukraine Kidnapped From Hospitals And Executed
Kiev is prepared to shutdown internet access, TV access, and put all citizens on house arrest starting tomorrow.

Denmark may soon be the first country in the world to issue a ban on non-therapeutic circumcision of boys. Calls it "Genital Mutilation". Meanwhile, Israel tries hard to block changes that are broadly perceived in Europe as a clear step forward in children's human rights.
Gangster who spilled the beans on Swedish king's visits to sex clubs in a scandalous unauthorized biography gunned down in Stockholm with four shots to the head
Video of police abducting activists from emergency hospital in Kyiv.
Every half hour, police keep bringing corpses to a Kyiv morgue

Founder Mark Zuckerberg just unloaded 41.4 million Facebook shares for $2.3 billion, ensuring that even if the stock price collapses, he will remain wealthy. Insider selling is, traditionally, a sign that a stock is overpriced.
